title: Billie Eilish’s Tiny Desk Concert
content:
During the pandemic, Billie Eilish did a Tiny Desk Concert at home amidst a very faithful recreation of the NPR office. Last week, Eilish played a proper set at the actual office. From the videoâ€™s description:

Saudade is a Portuguese word that can be roughly defined as a feeling of melancholy, nostalgia or yearning for something that is beloved but not present. Thereâ€™s no perfect translation, but one of the closest English expressions of the word Iâ€™ve ever seen is Billie Eilishâ€™s Tiny Desk performance.

Youâ€™d think the Los Angeles-born singer invented the term. Every breath is so full of indulgent melancholy, hopeful regret, at 22 years old sheâ€™s become a captivating fixture of what it means, or rather what it feels, to love and lose simultaneously.

Accompanied by a small band and her brother Finneas, Eilish played The Greatest, Lâ€™Amour de Ma Vie, i love you, and Birds of a Feather. Lovely.
